Package com.techhounds.houndutil.houndlib.leds

Class LEDPatterns

java.lang.Object
com.techhounds.houndutil.houndlib.leds.LEDPatterns
public class LEDPatterns extends Object
A class providing static consumers of AddressableLEDBuffers to create specific LED patterns.

    • solid

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> solid(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color color, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a solid LED pattern.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to set the LED section to
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • rainbow

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> rainbow(int brightness, int speed, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a moving rainbow pattern.
      Parameters:
      brightness - the brightness [0-255] of the colors used for the rainbow
      speed - the amount to move the first hue value by each timestep (recommended 3)
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • flash

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> flash(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color color, double onTime, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that flashes a specific color.
      Parameters:
      brightness - the brightness [0-255] of the colors used for the rainbow
      speed - the amount to move the first hue value by each timestep (recommended 3)
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • chase

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> chase(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color color, double length, double time, boolean multiple, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that triggers a bolt with a decreasing brightness tail across the LED section, similar to something being chased.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to set the bolt to
      length - the length of the bolt
      time - the amount of time to take to finish the movement of the bolt across the LED strip, and optionally the time after which to send a new bolt
      multiple - whether to continuously send bolts
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • chase

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> chase(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color primaryColor, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color secondaryColor, double length, double time, int minBrightness, boolean multiple, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that triggers a bolt with a decreasing brightness tail across the LED section, similar to something being chased. Interpolates between two colors.
      Parameters:
      primaryColor - the primary (starting) color to set the bolt to
      secondaryColor - the secondary (ending) color to set the bolt to
      length - the length of the bolt
      time - the amount of time to take to finish the movement of the bolt across the LED strip, and optionally the time after which to send a new bolt
      minBrightness - the brightness [0-255] at the end of the tail, used to ensure that the secondary color is visible
      multiple - whether to continuously send bolts
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • wave

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> wave(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color color, int length, double waveSpeed, int minBrightness, int maxBrightness, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that simulates a wave, with transition between a low and high brightness version of a color that moves through the strip using a sine function for smoothness.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to set the wave to
      length - the length of one period of the wave
      waveSpeed - the number of radians to shift the wave per second (recommended 1-3)
      minBrightness - the brightness at the lowest point of the wave
      maxBrightness - the brightness at the highest point of the wave
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • waveRainbow

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> waveRainbow(double rainbowSpeed, int length, double waveSpeed, int minBrightness, int maxBrightness, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that simulates a wave that continously changes in color over a rainbow.
      Parameters:
      rainbowSpeed - the amount to move the first hue value by each timestep (recommended 3)
      length - the length of one period of the wave
      waveSpeed - the number of radians to shift the wave per second (recommended 1-3)
      minBrightness - the brightness at the lowest point of the wave
      maxBrightness - the brightness at the highest point of the wave
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • breathe

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> breathe(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color color, double onTime, int minBrightness, int maxBrightness, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that moves a color between high and low brightness via a sine wave, which looks like "breathing".
      Parameters:
      color - the color to breathe with
      onTime - the amount of time, in seconds, that the strip should be on for
      minBrightness - the brightness at the lowest point of the breath (make this 0 to turn off the strip)
      maxBrightness - the brightness at the highest point of the breath
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • fire2012

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> fire2012(double sparking, double cooling, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that creates a flickering effect similar to a fire, with the base colors of a fire (red, yellow, and white). Algorithm derivative of Fire2012.
      Parameters:
      sparking - percentage likelihood of a new spark being lit. higher chance = more roaring fire, lower chance = more flickery fire. [0-1]
      cooling - how much the air cools as it rises. less cooling = taller flames, more cooling = shorter flames. [0-1]
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • fire2012Palette

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> fire2012Palette(double sparking, double cooling, List<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.Color> colors, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that creates a flickering effect similar to a fire, using a specfic palette of colors. Algorithm derivative of Fire2012.
      Parameters:
      sparking - percentage likelihood of a new spark being lit. higher chance = more roaring fire, lower chance = more flickery fire. [0-1]
      cooling - how much the air cools as it rises. less cooling = taller flames, more cooling = shorter flames. [0-1]
      colors - the list of colors to interpolate between. the first color indicates the lowest temperature (typically black), and the last color indicates the highest temperature. a palette resembling default Fire2012 would be List.of(Color.kBlack, Color.kRed, Color.kYellow, Color.kWhite).
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer

    • fire2012Rainbow

      public static Consumer<edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AddressableLEDBuffer> fire2012Rainbow(double sparking, double cooling, double rainbowSpeed, BaseLEDSection section)
      Creates a pattern that creates a flickering effect similar to a fire, with a moving rainbow as a base palette. Algorithm derivative of Fire2012.
      Parameters:
      sparking - percentage likelihood of a new spark being lit. higher chance = more roaring fire, lower chance = more flickery fire. [0-1]
      cooling - how much the air cools as it rises. less cooling = taller flames, more cooling = shorter flames. [0-1]
      rainbowSpeed - the amount to move the first hue value by each timestep (recommended 3)
      section - the LED section to use
      Returns:
      the generated LED buffer consumer
